thread.title: Greek stock market opens 23 percent down after five-week shutdown
thread.title_full: Greek stock market opens 23 percent down after five-week shutdown

author: Assignment Editor
title: Greek stock market opens 23 percent down after five-week shutdown
text:
Greek stock market opens 23 percent down after five-week shutdown Adv: 
By Jeremy Gaunt | Aug 03, 2015 Adv: 
Greece's stock market fell sharply on Monday after being shut down for five weeks under capital controls imposed by the government in Athens to stop a flight of euros from the country. 
The main index .ATG was down nearly 23 percent in early trading. National Bank of Greece (NBGr.AT), the country's largest commercial bank, was down 30 percent, the daily limit. 
The overall banking index .FTATBNK was also down its limit. Source: uk.reuters.com
